description: Borrowed from Spanish Quixote, the surname of Don Quixote, the title character in the novel by Miguel de Cervantes,  +â€Ž -ic.

adjectives.description: quixotic (comparative more quixotic, superlative most quixotic)

entries.meaning: Resembling or characteristic of the Spanish chivalric hero Don Quixote; possessed with or resulting from the desire to do noble and romantic deeds, without thought of realism and practicality; exceedingly idealistic.
